description: The problem detail segment contains the data necessary to add, update, correct, and delete the problems of a given individual.

fields.name: Action Code
fields.description: This field contains the intent of the message. Refer to HL7 table 0287 - Problem/goal action code for valid values.

fields.name: Action Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the date/time that the operation represented by the action code was performed.

fields.name: Problem ID
fields.description: This field identifies the problem. This is the identifier from an institution's master list of problems.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Problem Instance ID
fields.description: This field contains the identifier assigned by an initiating system to an instance of a problem.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Episode of Care ID
fields.description: This field uniquely identifies the episode of care to which this problem applies. (See note under "Ongoing issues.")

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Problem List Priority
fields.description: This field prioritizes this problem on a list that is maintained for the individual.

fields.name: Problem Established Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the date/time when the corresponding problem was initially identified by the caregiver.

fields.name: Anticipated Problem Resolution Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the estimated date/time for resolving the stated problem.

fields.name: Actual Problem Resolution Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the date/time that the problem was actually resolved.

fields.name: Problem Classification
fields.description: This field indicates the kind of problem. This field can be used to categorize problems so that they may be managed and viewed independently within different applications (e.g., admission, final, post-operative, pre-operative, outpatient, discharge, etc.).

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Problem Management Discipline
fields.description: This field indicates the category of caregiver with responsibility for managing this specific problem (e.g., care team, nursing, medicine, respiratory therapy, occupational therapy, dietary, etc.). This is a repeating field to allow identification of all disciplines that may have the responsibility for this problem.

If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Problem Persistence
fields.description: This field contains the perseverance of a problem (e.g., acute, chronic, etc.).

fields.name: Problem Confirmation Status
fields.description: This field contains the verification status of a problem (e.g., confirmed, differential, provisional, rule-out, etc.).

fields.name: Problem Life Cycle Status
fields.description: This field contains the current status of the problem at this particular date/time (e.g., active, active-improving, active-stable, active-worsening, inactive, resolved, etc.).

fields.name: Text

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Problem Life Cycle Status Date/Time
fields.description: This field indicates the effective date/time of the current problem life cycle status.

fields.name: Problem Date of Onset
fields.description: This field contains the date/time when the problem began.

fields.name: Problem Onset Text
fields.description: This field allows for a textual representation of the time when the problem began.

fields.name: Problem Ranking
fields.description: This field contains a user-defined prioritization of a problem (e.g., numeric ranking, or the use of words such as "primary," "secondary," etc.).

fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Certainty of Problem
fields.description: This field contains a qualitative representation of the certainty of a problem (e.g., HI - high, LO - low, ME - medium, etc.).

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Probability of Problem
fields.description: This field contains a quantitative or numeric representation of the certainty that the problem exists for this patient. This field has a valid range of 0 to 1. For example, a healthcare provider may be 75% (.75) sure that the problem has been correctly identified.

fields.name: Individual Awareness of Problem
fields.description: This field contains the individual's comprehension of the problem (e.g., full, marginal, partial, etc.).

fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Problem Prognosis
fields.description: This field contains the prognosis for the individual's problem (e.g., good, poor, etc.).

If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Mood Code
fields.description:
This field indicates the Mood of the Problem. It allows expression of the context of the problem.

Note:  As Mood Code changes the meaning of the segment it must only be used in new messages as of v2.6.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CNE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. This is the corresponding text assigned by the coding system to the identifier.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CNE.1 is obtained.Refer to HL7 Table 0396 - Coding System s in section 2.16.4, "Coding System Table" for valid values. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: Analogous to Identifier in component 1.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System in component 3. Refer to HL7 Table 0396 - Coding Systems in section 2.16.4, "Coding System Table" for valid values.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: the version ID for the coding system identified by component 3. It belongs conceptually to components 1-3 and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: the version ID for the coding system identified by component 6. It belongs conceptually to the group of Alternate components (see note 2.A.1) and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.
